users.name: Canal & River Trust
users.description: We're the charity who look after and bring to life 2,000 miles of waterways, because we believe #LifesBetterByWater. For queries contact @CRTContactUs

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
Our officers worked with Durham Constabulary last week to detain three suspected poachers. 

The men were using a 1.5m gaff to illegally spear salmon and trout spawning in shallow waters. Read more, including how to report poaching: https://t.co/UhZgPenmlW https://t.co/3MXLnVFDFx

tweets.text:
News: #Anlaby and #EastElla #Flood Alleviation Scheme wins prestigious national accolade https://t.co/LDvFKPUX3K

#FloodAlleviation #News @Hullccnews  @EnvAgency  #RICSAwards https://t.co/Yjb6yM4RCS
@bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Nickhod53168394 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Only certain roles are classed as key workers

@ManCityCouncil @CllrMaryM @EnvAgencyNW @NorthendenForum @love_northenden As at these days, here's the look of things (actually, a bit worse). Table still unanchored, pretty hazardous with all the broken slats. Not much progress in almost 2 months, don't you agree? Meanwhile, we pay our council tax & we exercise by this spot every day, by this damage. https://t.co/fpUhqX8VGt

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Officers seized 14 illegal traps from March to present day in #Suffolk and #Essex.
 
Throughout the pandemic our work to protect wildlife and the environment goes on - while following social distancing rules👍

Make sure you report all illegal #fishing activity to 0800 807060📞 https://t.co/agBCw6UBM1

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
The River Lugg, in Herefordshire, one of the most beautiful and important rivers in the UK, has been intentionally destroyed over a stretch of approximately 1.5km with huge repercussions for wildlife downstream 👇 

https://t.co/NKDHJhVn3s

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text: By removing barriers to their movement, our @SalmonStour project aims to see salmon return to the upper reaches of the River Stour & ensure passable water for all fish species at all times. Help us make it happen - share the tag #BBCWildlifexEcover! @EcoverUK #FertilisetheFuture https://t.co/brVzkun5QD

tweets.text:
The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg

urls.title: Beavers build first Exmoor dam in 400 years
urls.description: The National Trust says the dam in Somerset "might look modest, but it is incredibly special".

tweets.text: @CraigBennett3 @EdJudeNature @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts Tbh I wouldn't be surprised to learn it was the Env Agencies own work.

@Blacky_Himself @Nickhod53168394 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency it's not clear why they weren't allowed out... today the EA told me they are classed as key workers ... so they should have been able to do their jobs...
@RobGMacfarlane @mildthing99 @EnvAgency Do we know where on the Lugg this is?
@edfenergy @EnvAgency @SayNo2SizewellC https://t.co/X04mlBmwCW These animals are listed as vulnerable to extinction. Do not harm them. Stop Sizewell C. https://t.co/qeLReFqLQx
simples - saltmarshes ARE awesome @WWTSteart @EnvAgencySW @NESouthWest @RachelBurdenEA @H_Mossman @BlueCarbonLab @Estuarian4life @RAEstuaries https://t.co/o14NyDZcHg

@KeasdenKate @NaturalEngland @DefraGovUK @RachSalv @Unchecked_UK So much law apparently flouted here that @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm @HfdsCouncil @Ruralpay could all take enforcement action/prosecute. But I expect rather than fighting over it it will be more a matter of "No, after you Claud"

I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text: @JoKingDevon @grahamhrtn @CraigBennett3 @SteveCJjones @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts 1.5 km

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency @palaeoisotopes

TRENT TRANSFORMED
Aerial view of 1.5ha of new functional wet floodplain and over 500m of bifurcating channel  at Staffs Uni campus in Stoke
Even these massively degraded systems can be rejuvenated with vision 
@StaffsWildlife @SoTCityCouncil @EnvAgency @SalfordScience @StaffsUni https://t.co/rss99g49FK

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

Counting #salmon redds in Swindale Beck today with @EnvAgencyNW. Really decent numbers, with at least 43 redds seen in the 1km stretch at the bottom of the valley, and plenty further up too. Saw loads of big fish, dead & alive. #rivers https://t.co/CJviM1ZN7n

Havant Thicket Reservoir will bring many benefits to the environment such as helping to protect the wildlife in our rare chalk streams. Watch our short film to find out more.
https://t.co/vBSRqs3XXg...

Outdated flood sirens in Grimsby and Cleethorpes will not be used from 31 December.

Instead, the Flood Warning Service reaches more people with better information and is the best way to stay alert. Sign up https://t.co/SAcXCYjoCa

Read more https://t.co/apYdmzTrnS #Lincolnshire https://t.co/HpRrLAgbWu

tweets.text: 1/2: This is awful.  Vital that @NaturalEngland take swift action to investigate, prosecute and secure compensation.  As budgets have been slashed, they haven't done anything like enough of that stuff for years which might partly explain why... @DefraGovUK @RachSalv @Unchecked_UK https://t.co/fbxldLKwTP
